name: PostSocialSecurityBenefitByEmploymentId
description:
__Activity name:__ PostSocialSecurityBenefitByEmploymentId
    

Create a social security benefits record for an employment
__Metadata :__ Possible options for fields of the type 'metadata' can be acquired (GET) by adding `/metadata` to the POST URL.

__Defaults :__ Default values for a new object can be acquired by adding `/defaults' to the POST URL.

employmentId.description: The unique identifier of the employment

Authorization.description: A valid Bearer token for authorizing the request.

Accept.description: The accept header is used to influence what type of output is returned and in most cases the version of the output

$ul: **obsoleteDate**: The date (can be null) on which the `resourceVersion` is no longer supported/available
**resourceVersion**: The resource version of the object in the response
**endDate**: The end date of the entity. The date is up to and including.
**id**: The unique identifier of an object (GUID/UUID)
**startDate**: The start date of the entity. Valide values are either the startDate of the employment or the firstday of a payrolling year.
**percentage**: If supplementation is applied then the supplementation percentage (up to) is registered here.
**type**: Indicates whether and how supplementation should be applied. This is used when the employer supplements the pay out percentage.

**percentage**: Pay out percentage of the benefit (deviating from the administration). This value determines the percentage to be applied, the only exception is when type of benefit is set to AOW where the percentage cannot be in altered (=0).
**type**: The type of social security benefit that is applicable. Per type of benefit a so-called closed-chain input validation is used. This field cannot be changed after the initial post.
**obsoleteDate**: The date (can be null) on which the `resourceVersion` is no longer supported/available
**resourceVersion**: The resource version of the object in the response
